True or false? A cat cannot sweat. If false, please explain how they do sweat. 


False. Cats do have the ability to sweat, but it is limited and different from humans. Cats have sweat glands in their paws, which they use to regulate body temperature. When a cat feels hot, it will lick its paws, allowing the evaporating moisture to help cool down the paw pads and, consequently, its whole body. Additionally, cats can also sweat through their skin to a much lesser extent.

The answer is: False.
